actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Indian Affairs.

official_title: A bill to provide for conveyance of certain Navajo Nation lands located in northwestern New Mexico and to resolve conflicts among the members of such Nation who hold interests in allotments on such lands.

summary.text: Bisti PRLA Dispute Resolution Act - Directs the Secretary of the Interior, upon the relinquishment by certain holders of coal preference right lease applications, to issue to each such holder a Certificate of Bidding Rights that constitutes the fair market value of the relinquished rights. Provides a fair market value determination method.Directs the Secretary: (1) no later than July 15, 2000, to verify the selection of current Bureau of Land Management lands in New Mexico made by the Navajo Indian Nation pursuant to a resettlement plan for the Navajo Tribe; and (2) within 30 days thereafter, to issue patents to the Navajo Nation to the relinquished coal preference rights.

titles.title: A bill to provide for conveyance of certain Navajo Nation lands located in northwestern New Mexico and to resolve conflicts among the members of such Nation who hold interests in allotments on such lands.
